page.title: 05The Royal Grammar School (C)
page.content: The Royal Grammar School was endowed by John Gardyner in 1472,but it is known from legal documents to have been in existence before then.The original site of the school was close to the Priory Church near the centre of the city. As the school increased in size and began to take in borders,new buildings were erected in 1852 on East Road.Today the school occupies a large area below the Ashton Memorial. There are about 850 boys on roll including nearly 200 borders.There are over 240 boys in the 6th form. Each year about 90 day-boys and 30 boarders are admitted in the 11+ age group.Places for day-boys are awarded on the basis of performance in a selection test. A few additional boarding places are allocated on the results of the Common Entrance exam at 13+.Some boys enter the school on the basis of 'O'Level results.
